comment.author: 65411336@N05
comment._content:
Didn't the McWilliams sign have a grape dropping into that glass created by turning on and off a few lights in sequence?

As for Vincents APC: "...comprised aspirin, phenacetin, and caffeine. (A.P.C.) prior to 1967 when Vincent's replaced phenacetin with salicylamide." This was from the South Australian Medical Heritage Society website.

comment.author: 65411336@N05
comment._content: Correction, it wasn't from the SAMHS website, but from a paper in the 1978 Kidney International Journal: www.pkdiet.com/pdf/pkdpain/australia78.pdf

comment.author: 27331537@N06
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/65411336@N05] Thanks for adding this info. I'm curious now as to whether we can find a photo showing the grape droppping into the glass.

AB
